title: Understanding the Rows Area
text: The rows area in a PivotTable is where you organize your data into categories. Each field you add here becomes a subset of the previous field, creating a hierarchy.

title: Hierarchy in Rows Area
text: When you add multiple fields to the rows area, they are organized in a hierarchical manner. The first field becomes the main category, and subsequent fields become subcategories.

hintAnswer: fields added to the rows area become subsets of the first field
title: Identify the Correct Statement
text: Which of the following statements correctly describes the rows area in a PivotTable?
choices: report filter and filter button in the PivotTable, representing a subset that meets a selection criterion
fields directly added to the columns fields should contain summary numeric area
fields added to the rows area become subsets of the first field
fields added to the values area must contain numeric data from the source data
